summaries.body: The Red Cross said it was temporarily suspending its operations in Yemen’s southern port city of Aden after gunmen stormed the group's offices.

display_asset.caption: Augusta Chiwy was honored in 2011 for saving Americans during World War II.

summaries.body: Augusta Chiwy, a Belgian nurse whose bravery in saving countless American soldiers wounded in the Battle of the Bulge was belatedly celebrated in 2011, died at 94.

display_asset.caption: Curt Schilling was removed from his current assignment covering the Little League World Series by ESPN, "pending further consideration."

summaries.body: Curt Schilling, the former Boston Red Sox pitcher, was pulled from a Little League World Series broadcast after he compared Muslims to Nazi-era Germans in a Twitter post.

display_asset.caption: Receiver Reggie Wayne last had a Pro Bowl and 1,000-yard season in 2012

summaries.body: The Super Bowl champion New England Patriots signed the veteran receiver Reggie Wayne on Tuesday.
At a museum in Taiwan, a 12-year-old boy tripped and punched a fist-size hole in a painting worth about $1.5 million.
Jon Stewart certainly seems to be enjoying his retirement. After 16 years sitting behind the desk at “The Daily Show,” the comedian is a budding wrestling star.

display_asset.caption: A lion in the Hwange National Park.

summaries.body: A safari guide was killed by a lion in the same Zimbabwe park that was home to Cecil the Lion, who was killed by an American dentist.

display_asset.caption: A reflection in a Coca-Cola store window display in Mexico City last year.

summaries.body: Coca-Cola expects to reach its water replenishment goal five years earlier than planned. In 2007, the company set out to replace the water that it uses around the world to make its beverages — about 160 billion liters — by 2020.

display_asset.caption: Migrants slept in a corridor inside a center  housing about 3,000 migrants in Friedland, Germany, on Tuesday.

summaries.body: The U.N. predicts 3,000 refugees a day will pass through the Balkans, hours before a recreation center intended to house asylum seekers is burned down in Germany.

display_asset.caption: On graduation day, the pain of filling out financial aid forms may seem a distant memory.
display_asset.credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times

summaries.body: A suggestion to eliminate the college financial aid form, Fafsa, led to a discussion about empathy, coddling and fraud.

display_asset.caption: Cornel West spoke at the Tidewater Community College's Roper Center in Norfolk, Va., as part of its Words of Wisdom series in 2011.
display_asset.credit: Amanda Lucier/The Virginian-Pilot, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Cornel West endorsed Senator Bernie Sanders for president, bolstering a candidate who has drawn huge crowds but also skepticism from black voters.

Singapore dissolved Parliament and called for a general election on Sept. 11. Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, above, said on his Facebook page that he is seeking a mandate to take Singapore into its next half century.
The Spanish authorities said at least 14 people believed to be members of a cell that recruited fighters for the Islamic State have been arrested in Spain and Morocco.

display_asset.caption: Lisa Johnson and other members of the Sistahs on the Reading Edge book club before departing for the Napa Valley Wine Train.

summaries.body: The ouster of a group of women, almost all of them black, from a California train tour over complaints that they were making too much noise led to accusations of racial bias.
At least nine people were killed in Nepal after demonstrators against a draft constitution broke a curfew and attacked police officers with knives, spears and sickles.
A Marine accused of killing a transgender woman in the Philippines said he had choked her until she was no longer moving, but stopped short of saying that he had killed her.
Chipotle said it planned to hire 4,000 workers nationwide in a single day next month. So-called fast-casual restaurants like Chipotle have been booming.
NASA’s Cassini spacecraft has made its final flyby of Dione, the fourth largest of Saturn’s more than 60 moons, delighting astronomers with new detailed images.

display_asset.caption: Senior Trooper Steven J. Vincent
display_asset.credit: Louisiana State Police, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Louisiana state trooper died Monday after being shot in the head a day earlier during a traffic stop. Passing motorists helped to apprehend the suspected gunman.

display_asset.credit: The Canadian Press, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The fallout continues from a data breach of Ashley Madison, the adultery website, as international authorities search for the hackers.

display_asset.caption: The second of two newborn giant pandas is cared for by members of the panda team.

summaries.body: Raising healthy panda cub twins will be a singular problem for the National Zoo's mother panda, Mei Xiang: Only two other bears have successfully done so in captivity.
Hard on the heels of his retirement from “The Daily Show,” Jon Stewart hosted World Wrestling Entertainment’s 28th annual SummerSlam on Sunday. He also threw a chair.
Why being the unanimous pick for the No. 1 team in college football in the preseason is bad news for Ohio State.

display_asset.caption: Stephen Colbert's inaugural "Late Show" guest list includes film, TV and music stars, as well as  figures from the worlds of politics, business and literature.

summaries.body: Stephen Colbert, the new host of CBS’s “The Late Show,” unveiled the roster of his first week of guests, and it included more than TV and movie stars.
On Saturday, the rapper Wiz Khalifa, above, was forced to the ground and arrested at the Los Angeles International Airport during a confrontation involving a hoverboard.

display_asset.caption: In downtown Beirut, Lebanon, the garbage crisis took a violent turn on Sunday when protesters and the police clashed.
display_asset.title: Protesters and Police Clash in Lebanon

summaries.body: Protesters and the police clashed on Sunday night in downtown Beirut, as Lebanon's long-running garbage crisis took a violent turn.

posts.footer: The toll continues to rise after a fighter jet taking part in a British airshow on Saturday crashed into a highway, via Twitter

summaries.body: Final death toll from Shoreham air crash could rise to 20, Sussex Police say http://t.co/IJllJv91Ky
Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan will not attend China's military parade on Sept. 3 to commemorate the end of World War II, a government spokesman said on Monday.
On Monday, Prime Minister Tony Abbott became the first leader of Australia to visit the grave of the indigenous land rights campaigner Eddie Koiki Mabo.
Hong Xudong, a Chinese man who was kidnapped while cycling through Pakistan in 2014, has been freed by the security forces, according to the Pakistani government.
